Text: Sri Lankan Tamil militant groups rose to prominence in the 1970s to fight the state of Sri Lanka in order to create an independent Tamil Eelam in the north of Sri Lanka.

<Text: Sri Lankan Tamil militant groups:  By the end of 1987, the militants had fought not only the Sri Lankan security forces but also the Indian Peace Keeping Force.>

Text: Sri Lankan Tamil militant groups:  They also fought among each other briefly, with the main Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) rebel group dominating the others.
